context: using Pabbly or Make.com for AI-powered job post generation and publishing
description: Automate LinkedIn job posting process: AI generates compelling job posts from Google Sheets data, auto-publishes to LinkedIn, saving 1-2 hours per posting. Part of Week 3 content generation implementation.

ChatGPT/Claude API key for content generation
Google Sheets for job data entry

steps.name: Choose automation platform (Pabbly vs Make.com)
inputs: Budget: Pabbly (cheaper, $19/month) vs Make (free tier available, $9-29/month)
Complexity: Make more powerful, Pabbly simpler

steps.name: Create Google Sheets template for job posting data
inputs: Required fields: Job Title, Department, Location, Employment Type, Experience Level, Salary Range, Key Responsibilities (bullet points), Required Skills, Nice-to-Have Skills, Company Benefits, Application Link, Status (Draft/Ready to Post/Posted)
outputs: Google Sheets template: LinkedIn Job Postings
Data validation for dropdowns (Employment Type, Experience Level, Status)

steps.name: Setup AI content generation (ChatGPT or Claude API)

steps.name: Connect LinkedIn API for posting
steps.success_criteria: LinkedIn API connected, test post created in draft successfully

steps.name: Build complete workflow: Google Sheets → AI → LinkedIn

steps.success_criteria: Workflow executes end-to-end, job posted to LinkedIn, status updated in Sheets

steps.name: Create AI prompt template for LinkedIn posts
inputs: LinkedIn best practices (hook, value prop, CTA)
steps.success_criteria: Prompt consistently generates high-quality, on-brand LinkedIn posts

steps.name: Add optional manual review step

steps.success_criteria: HR manager can review and approve/reject posts before publishing

steps.name: Test workflow with sample job posting
inputs: Sample job posting data in Google Sheets
outputs: Post published to LinkedIn company page
Status updated to 'Posted' in Google Sheets
steps.success_criteria: Complete workflow successful, post published on LinkedIn, looks professional

steps.name: Optimize AI output based on first test
inputs: Feedback: tone, length, formatting, emoji usage, hashtags
steps.success_criteria: Second test produces better results, minimal editing needed

compliance_notes: LinkedIn API Terms of Service: Respect rate limits (max 25 posts per day per company page). Do not spam or post duplicate content. Ensure job postings comply with employment law (no discriminatory language). Store API credentials securely.

troubleshooting.solution: Re-authenticate OAuth connection, verify company page admin permissions, check API access is enabled for company page

troubleshooting.issue: AI-generated post too long for LinkedIn (max 3000 characters)
troubleshooting.solution: Add character limit instruction to prompt: 'Keep post under 300 words (approximately 1500-1800 characters)'

troubleshooting.issue: Posts not appearing on LinkedIn feed
troubleshooting.solution: Check if post went to drafts instead of published, verify LinkedIn API posting permissions, check for API error messages

troubleshooting.issue: AI uses inappropriate tone or language
troubleshooting.solution: Refine prompt with explicit tone guidelines, add examples of good/bad posts, use temperature=0.3 for more consistent output
Use polling trigger (every 15 minutes) instead of instant, verify Sheets permissions allow Pabbly/Make access

optimization_tips: Schedule posts for optimal LinkedIn engagement times (Tue-Thu, 10am-12pm)
Use A/B testing: create 2 AI variations, track engagement, optimize prompt based on better performer
Add image generation: use AI to suggest stock images or create visuals with Canva API
Track post performance: LinkedIn API can fetch engagement metrics, store in Google Sheets for analysis
Create post variations for different platforms (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter) from same job data
Use hashtag research: AI suggests trending hashtags in industry
linkedin_post_best_practices: Hook: First 2 lines visible in feed - must grab attention
Emojis: Use strategically for visual breaks (3-5 per post max)
Call-to-action: Clear link to apply, deadline if applicable
Formatting: Short paragraphs, bullet points with emojis, white space
Tone: Professional yet human, showcase company culture
SEO: Include job title, location, key skills for search visibility
future_enhancements: Multi-platform posting: Auto-publish to Facebook Jobs, Twitter, company website simultaneously
Applicant tracking: Track which applications came from LinkedIn post
Performance analytics dashboard: Engagement metrics, application conversion rate per post
AI image generation: Auto-create branded job post graphics
Dynamic content: Personalize posts based on LinkedIn audience demographics
Auto-boost: Allocate ad budget to high-performing posts automatically
Candidate nurturing: Auto-engage with commenters, answer questions via chatbot
